fields.headline: Dunfermline line up Moravcik
fields.bodyText: The former Celtic midfielder Lubomir Moravcik has a firm interest in replacing Stephen Kenny as the Dunfermline Athletic manager, after the Irishman was sacked yesterday. Moravcik, a hero at Parkhead during his time in Glasgow between 1998 and 2002, is keen to forge a career in management after a spell coaching Slovakia's under-17 team and his identified Dunfermline as the ideal post in which to begin that process. "There is 100% interest from Lubo in that job," said a source close to the Slovakwho has scored 29 goals in 75 league starts for Celtic. Neil Lennon and Steven Pressley have been linked with replacing Kenny but neither is understood to be interested. The Derry City manager John Robertson is a leading candidate, as is Dunfermline's former manager Dick Campbell. Kenny presided over a disastrous start to the season with the first division club, who were relegated from the Premier League in May and lost narrowly to Celtic in the Scottish Cup final. The are currently second bottom of the First Division with their promotion aspirations in tatters. The likelihood of the Chilean striker Mauricio Pinilla turning out for Hearts again has diminished further after the 23-year-old lasted five minutes of his return to training following a hamstring injury. Pinilla has featured only four times for the Tynecastle side since moving to Edinburgh last year and has courted off-field controversy several times in his homeland. Hearts spent £35,000 placing him in a Spanish clinic three months ago, with the striker suffering from depression. His latest setback increases the likelihood that Hearts will seek to offload the player, who has also played for Sporting Lisbon, Racing Santander and Celta Vigoin the January transfer window. .
